alert.note: Alert for Coastal Miami Dade County; Far South Miami-Dade County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 5:05PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Miami-Dade County through 545 PM EDT... At 505 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Royal Palm Ranger, or 12 miles northwest of Jewfish Creek Bridge, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Miami-Dade County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. This activity was also developing in an environment favorable for the formation of funnel clouds. Stay tuned to NOAA weather radio and local media for additional updates and possible warnings.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Miami Dade County; Far South Miami-Dade County
